  • pushto.telescope

pushto.telescope¶

Interface to telescope

  • Handles communication with Arduino connected to serial port, using the pyserial package to create a threaded serial reader

  • Transforms data from encoder counts to raw telescope attitude to corrected telescope attitude

  • Publishes data to a zmq PUB socket

Provides:

  • Encoders

  • PointingModel

  • Telescope

class pushto.telescope.Telescope(port, pub_address, cfg=None, ctx=None)¶

Handles the threaded serial reader and publishes the encoder data to a zmq PUB socket.

Parameters:

  • port (str) – serial port that arduino is connected to

  • pub_address (str) – address to publish data to

  • baud (int) – baud rate of serial port, optional [9600]

  • zmq_ctx (zmq.Context) – the zmq context to use, optional [None]

>>> scope = Telescope('/dev/cu.usbmodem143301', 'tcp://127.0.0.1:10011')
>>> scope.start()
>>> scope.close()

Note

Serial data is expected to be a string terminated with CR LF and containing 5 interger-parsable fields separated by spaces:

‘<msec> <azi_cnt> <alt_cnt> <azi_err> <alt_err>CRLF’

Published data is a JSON dictionary:

{‘time’: ‘2034’, ‘azi_cnt’: ‘-548’, ‘alt_cnt’: ‘870’, ‘azi_err’: ‘0’, ‘alt_err’: ‘1’}

close()¶

Signal to downstream components, close the PUB, and stop the reader thread.

classmethod setup(cfg, ctx=None)¶

Convence method for creating a Telescope object based on a Configuration object

Parameters:

cfg (Configuration) – the configuration object to use

Returns:

the telescope

Return type:

Telescope

start()¶

Start the reader thread

class pushto.telescope.Encoders(phi_npr=0, theta_npr=0, flip_phi=False, flip_theta=False)¶

Encoders class. Handles transformation from encoder counts to raw attitude.

Parameters:

  • theta_npr (int) – number of counts per revolution, including gearing, of polar encoder

  • phi_npr (int) – number of counts per revolution, including gearing, of azimuthal encoder

  • flip_theta (bool) – flip the sense (CW<->CCW) of rotation of the polar encoder

  • flip_phi (bool) – flip the sense (CW<->CCW) of rotation of the azimuthal encoder

>>> encoders = Encoders(phi_npr=2400, theta_npr=2400)
>>> phi, theta = encoders.convert(1200, 1200)
config(cfg)¶

Configure encoder parameters from the configuration object.

Parameters:

cfg (pushto.Configuration) – the configuration

>>> encoders = Encoders()
>>> encoders.config(cfg)
>>> phi, theta = encoders.convert(1200, 1200)
convert(phi_cnt, theta_cnt)¶

Convert from encoder counts to raw telescope attitude (phi, theta)

Parameters:

  • phi_cnt (long) – count of azimuthal encoder

  • theta_cnt (long) – count of polar encoder

Returns:

theta and phi, in degrees

Return type:

list(float)

class pushto.telescope.PointingModel(ia=0, ie=0, an=0, aw=0, ca=0, npae=0, tx=0, tf=0)¶

8 parameter pointing model of Tpoint

Handles transformation from raw attitude to corrected attitude

Parameters:

  • ia (float) – index error in azimuth

  • ie (float) – index error in elevation

  • an (float) – north-south misalignment of azimuth axis

  • aw (float) – west-east misalignment of azimuth axis

  • ca (float) – non-perpendicularity of optical axis and elevation axis

  • npae (float) – non-perpendicularity of elevation axis and azimuth axis

  • tx (float) – tube flexure term proportional to cot(el)

  • tf (float) – tube flexure term proportional to cos(el)

>>> pm = PointingModel()
>>> phi, theta = pm.apply(180, 45)
apply(phi, theta)¶

Convert from raw telescope attitude to corrected telescope attitude

Parameters:

  • phi (float) – raw azimuthal angle

  • theta (float) – raw altitude angle

Returns:

phi and theta, in degrees

Return type:

list(float)

config(cfg)¶

Configure pointing model from the configuration object.

Parameters:

cfg (pushto.Configuration) – the configuration

>>> pm = PointingModel()
>>> pm.config(cfg)
>>> phi, theta = pm.apply(180, 45)
